snippet: Experts estimate so-called budget sequestration could cost the country about 700,000 jobs, but Wall Street doesn’t expect the cuts to substantially alter corporate profits or threaten stock markets.
abstract: Split between American workers and companies that employ them, which is widening as corporate profits increase while economy stagnates and unemployment remains high, could worsen in next few months as federal budget cuts take hold; experts estimate that so-called budget sequestration could cost country about 700,000 jobs, but Wall Street does not expect cuts to substantially alter corporate profits or threaten stock markets.
lead_paragraph: Experts estimate so-called budget sequestration could cost the country about 700,000 jobs, but Wall Street doesn’t expect the cuts to substantially alter corporate profits or threaten stock markets.

headline.seo: Corporate Profits Soar as Worker Income Limps
headline.main: Recovery in U.S. Is Lifting Profits, but Not Adding Jobs
headline.print_headline: Recovery in U.S. Lifting Profits, Not Adding Jobs
